item.title: The 'Why' of Engineering
item.description: Start with the ‘Why’ I want to start off with a simple yet strong idea. Why you do something is more important than what you do The first time I heard this was in a TED talk by Simon Sinek. He speaks about a common pattern in all the great inspirers. They all started with “why” they did what they did. At first, I thought this was just another leadership talk that you find on the internet.

item.title: College: What went wrong, what went right
item.description: In 2014 when I started college I dreamt of being a great student. I picked computer science as my major because I loved the field. I was happy, confident and excited. After all, I had straight A+s in class Xth and 90% in class 12, what could go wrong ? After 4 years of college, I have 7 backpapers with a history of at least 15 failed papers (along with a couple of research papers though) to my name.
